properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 30 at 6:27PM MST until January 30 at 6:45PM MST by NWS Denver CO
properties.description:
At 627 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line
extending from 9 miles southeast of Briggsdale to 7 miles northwest
of Natural Fort, or along a line extending from 27 miles northwest of
Fort Morgan to 14 miles southwest of Cheyenne, moving south at 45
mph.

HAZARD...Heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 45 mph.

SOURCE...Radar and webcams.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 272 and 297.

Locations impacted include...
Wellington, Eaton, Severance, Ault, Pierce, Nunn, Purcell, Carr,
Galeton, Natural Fort, Barnesville, Rockport, Briggsdale and
Livermore.
properties.instruction:
Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes
your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra
time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead
to accidents.

Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges
and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be
prepared for sudden loss of traction.

NWSheadline: A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MST FOR NORTHWESTERN WELD AND NORTHEASTERN LARIMER COUNTIES
